alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 12:44AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A heavy shower capable of producing funnel clouds will impact portions of northeastern Seminole, northwestern Brevard and southeastern Volusia Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1242 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a shower near Maytown, or 8 miles northeast of Geneva, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds of 30 to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Smyrna Beach, Edgewater, Oak Hill, Scottsmoor, and Geneva. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Seminole
